channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2023070129
item.description:
Report X-2023070129

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-27T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UPON INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND THAT THE SIDE AND TOP OF THE BOX WERE CORRODED. IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE CONTENTS HAD LOOSE CAPS RESULTING IN THE LEAKAGE AND DAMAGE OF THE BOX DescribePack: LOOSE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN A PLASTIC BAG INSIDE A TOTE

item.title: Report X-2023070123
item.description:
Report X-2023070123

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-27T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-27
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When package was being unloaded from the trailer, it was wet so package was sent to QA for inspection by management. When inspected, one bottles inside package was found with loose caps causing leakage. DescribePack: Loose cap on plastic bottle was the cause of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a plastic tote by management to contain the leakage.

X-2023070171 SequenceEvent: LID FELL OFF AND LIQUID LEAKED ALL OVER BOX DescribePack: 12 X 12 HOLE IN BOX DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ABSORBENT AND PLASTIC BAG

item.title: Report X-2023061711
item.description:
Report X-2023061711

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-27T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-27
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The exterior box was wet on the top, underside and side when it was found and removed from the sort stream. The excess liquid was sopped up using neutral absorbent materials . The rest was placed into a plastic lined container for inspection and processing. DescribePack: Both of the bottles had finger loose caps on them. They also had dents on the handles near the bend area. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up by absorbent materials and the rest of the shipment was removed from the discovery site and sequestered inside a plastic lined container for processing.

item.description:

  • City: KETTLEMAN CITY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one 237 poly tote of phosphoric acid (un1805) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 9 ounces of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023061614
item.description:
Report X-2023061614

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-24T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was in the process of being unloaded. Upon arrival the package was placed in a hazardous bin layered with absorbent, a hazardous waste bag, and another layer of absorbent. DescribePack: On the side flaps of the box there is a wet stained about a 1.6 inches in diameter. The degreaser seeped through from the inner part of the box to the otter. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When arriving to the unload we found the hazmat and placed it in a red hazardous bin layered with 4 sheets of absorbent, a hazardous materials bag, and another 4 sheets of absorbent..

item.title: Report E-2023070068
item.description:
Report E-2023070068

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: SAN LORENZO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 15, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of sulfuric acid was punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted surface. AS identified the damaged pail and solidified the remaining contents in one (1) 30-gallon drum. AS deployed absorbents to the product on the concrete and utilized hand tools to collect the impacted solids in a separate 30-gallon drum. Both drums were labeled and staged onsite to be profiled by R+L personnel

DescribePack: Loose Cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Tightened the cap and placed in a hazardous material bag, inside a yellow salvage drum.
